Text:
For the emergencies never go to this hospital, I really had a bad experience. I took my friend who was suffering from Covid, we got there at 10am and some nurses came in and checked her very quickly and they took her somewhere inside and told me to wait until theyâ€™ll call my name , I spent 2 hours I went to the reception and ask them about the doctor and they said â€œthe doctor is not here yet you have to waitâ€ Iâ€™ve waited 1 more hour and my friend sent me message â€œim thirsty can you get me some water plz?â€ And again I went to the reception asked them to pass the  water to my friend, but they refused to pass it and showed me the attitude saying â€œ you cannot do that the patient canâ€™t have anything before seeing the doctorâ€ I told them , itâ€™s been 3 hours when will the come? Itâ€™s been 3 hours they said â€œ you have to wait 2 more hours, I kept calm and waited for 2 more hours but still there was no doctor, my friend was having trouble in where she was waiting, and I felt hopeless and I asked them to bring her out Iâ€™m gonna take her to another hospital, and they immediately without explaining  anything opened the door such careless. I took her out and went to another hospital.
The staff were chilling in smoke doesnâ€™t care anything about the patients the receptionist were rude and donâ€™t try hear anything we say instead they were using cellphones, I recommend you not to visit this hospital totally I spent 7 hours still there was no doctor to see the patient ğŸ¤¬ğŸ¤¬ğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘ğŸ»ğŸ‘ğŸ»

Text: I took my 8month old daughter to the child emergency and even though they checked her quite fast the nurses at the reception were pathetic, rude and in a hurry to shoo us out of the check up room. A nurse asked me to hurry up and leave as  i was trying to put a diaper on my daughter. My daughter got scared of the nurses loud voice and started crying so i having a hard time putting onher diaper. The nurse then came in open the exit door and gestured with her hands to leave while sayisaying get out. I had to get out whith my daughter and she endep up peeing on me.A total nightmare.

Text: Long waiting time for emergencies. It is such a chaotic, dirty, loud and crowded hospital that makes you forget you are in the rich and fancy city of Paris.

Text: Staff are careless, lazy, useless and greedy. They fixed an appointment for us which happened to fall on the day they wanted to strike for "more salary" and they didn't even bother to inform us that the appointment was canceled. If you have such poor ethics in your establishment, then you don't deserve a higher salary.

Name: Thomas Lembcke
Text:
I spent five useless days in the hopital sejour, the staff is uncaring and frankly after being put through the wringer for an EMG test which felt like I was being electrocuted, the pain was incredible. I had to yell at the  so called Doctor to Stop and I got of the table and started to get dressed, i was so stressed out and it seemed my heart was jumping out of my chest! I have had severe peripheral neuropathy diagnosis in the USA in 2013
The Doctor who wrote the Report was a Intern which does not even give him the rights to Diagnose nothing without the Signature of A so called qualified Physician and those People are Not really interested in the ill folks being treated there. All I want to tell you is STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOSPITAL I feel traumatized since.

Name: Yayate
Text:
Mon avis concerne le service MaternitÃ©, qui m'a agrÃ©ablement surpris sur tous les points.

Nous avons Ã©tÃ© dans un premier temps trÃ¨s bien suivi pour les consultations prÃ©natale. La sage-femme P. a Ã©tÃ© bienveillante et spontanÃ©e avec nous, assurant un vÃ©ritable suivi, et n'hÃ©sitant pas Ã  nous tÃ©lÃ©phoner au besoin.

Le jour aux urgences, Nous avons trÃ¨s bien Ã©tÃ© accueillis par l'Ã©quipe de nuit durant l'accouchement. Le personnel a Ã©tÃ© formidable, trÃ¨s professionnel, et trÃ¨s humain, mettant mon Ã©pouse dans les meilleures conditions possibles pour son premier accouchement.
La sage-femme N., qui s'est occupÃ©e de Madame pendant toute la nuit, a Ã©tÃ© d'une grande gentillesse et d'une grande douceur, nous tenons encore Ã  la remercier.

Par la suite, le sÃ©jour s'est trÃ¨s bien passÃ©. Les Ã©quipes sont bienveillantes et toujours Ã  disposition, mon bÃ©bÃ© toujours Ã©tÃ© bien attentionnÃ© par le personnel soignant.

Il y a encore du trÃ¨s bon dans le service public : il suffit de leur donner du soutien, des moyens, de la confiance et on obtient un vrai service de qualitÃ©, quelque soit le domaine.
C'est une chose qui risque malheureusement de disparaÃ®tre...

En tout cas Merci encore et Courage au personnel soignant !

Name: Silvia Morbin
Text:
I put one star because you can't do less.
In summary: VERY RUDE AND UNPROFESSIONAL staff (with the exception of only two nurses, unprofessional but at least kind), filth, sick people screaming on stacked beds in dirty, dark and fetid corridors.
The wait in the emergency room (where, if you are not French, you come after everyone) is followed by a "visit" by an INTERN, carried out in a DIRTY DIRTY DIRTY, very ugly and not at all comfortable room (attached). After this "visit" (carried out, in fact, by the intern and by a not at all professional "doctor") the response is "now let's discuss it with the boss".
After waiting half an hour in the "room" I go out to ask for information, I meet a VERY rude nurse who tells me that I have to go back to my BOX immediately and that it will still take a long time because the boss has to examine my dossier and that before my ce there are many others. The intern also arrives, who suggests that I lie down on the BED (attached). Following several grumpy responses from the nurse in question and facing an indefinitely long wait inside the BOX, I decide to leave before receiving any diagnosis (which, at that point, I would not have given any credit due to the total lack of professionalism that characterizes this """hospital""").
NOT RECOMMENDED!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Name: Michel Zattera
Text:
I am an Italian tourist who came to Paris for a family trip. Following a very strong gastroenteritis, I had to rush to the emergency room, accompanied by my parents because I couldn't even stand up. As soon as we entered, we tried to explain ourselves to the receptionists, but none of them spoke English and they were very rude and indifferent. At that point we were left to fend for ourselves on chairs where we had to wait a total of over 6 hours and I kept throwing up and doubled over in pain. After a long time they let me into another room, they didn't allow me to let my parents in because I'm of age (but I repeat that I couldn't stand up and had no support from the nurses). There no one helped me again, and they left me there in a chair for at least another hour and a half. At one point I had to lie down on the floor because I couldn't take it anymore and nobody helped me or asked for anything, even though the staff kept walking back and forth in the corridors. In the end, the only kind people were the doctor and the nurse who finally gave me a drip, which made me recover, but the virus was practically gone by now. Leaving aside the general filth of the premises, the worst thing really was the shameful and utter indifference of the staff.
Absolutely not recommended!!!

Name: Marc S
Text: Bonne prise en charge aux urgences et passage aux radios rapide. Diagnostique d'un docteur sympathique et empathique. Bien.

Name: Blandine Maillard
Text: Not sure why this place isn't doing well in the reviews. Personally, I had the loveliest experience here with my family for a birthday trip in Paris. The staff are 12/10, so so friendly and always going above and beyond to help guests out (and are available 24 hours a day, might I add). I'm diabetic and needed some sugar one night at 10 pm, the receptionist quickly ran to the hotel kitchen to grab a huge carton of brand new orange juice to keep in my room for whenever I need it. That is only one of countless good experiences at Hotel Clairefontaine. I visited in December and found the place super charming, bedroom heaters were incredibly useful, rooms were very well cleaned and organized every time we'd come back from a long day out in the town, and as I said, the staff were the loveliest part of the trip. They felt like family by the end of our stay. Would definitely come back and stay here and recommend it to my friends and family for when they visit Paris.

Name: Patty Shinnick
Text:
This charming hotel was in a great location with lots to do and see. The receptionist was most welcoming and was very patient with my poor French. She, upon my request,  helped me with some pronunciation. She was lovely and offered some refreshment upon my arrival. Great customer service!
The amenities in my room (named Underground) have been updated with the exception of AC but housekeeping provided a fan which helped a bit.
My only concern was the condition of the walls. There were damaged walls with big holes that need to be repaired.

Name: fotis kostoglou
Text: the rooms are very small and dirty since there was mold in some parts of the bathroom.  The breakfast cost â‚¬15 and was really non-existent, it only had 2 biscuits and coffee.  the staff was not helpful.  In general, a very bad experience, I do not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Name: N00bDadGamer
Text: WiFi is a serious problem. The connection is very poor, sometimes doesnâ€™t work at all. Despite addressing this multiple times, no solution was ever made. Shower towels were very small, barely fit us. Cleanliness was average. The rooms were tidy but the floor remained dirty for most of the time. In the eating area, the microwave was not consistently clean from the inside. The overall staff were super kind, trustworthy, sweet and caring.

Name: Gareth Gibson
Text: Lovely little hotel with a relaxing atmosphere due to the indoors outdoors landing where you can sit and have a smoke and a coffee if you so wish. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was a great start to the day (except the day I skipped it because I was up at 5.30 to go for a walk around Paris. Great hotel in what appeared to me to be the very lively district of Montparnasse. I recommend this hotel and the area to anyone looking for a reasonably priced and affordable stay in Paris. Local transport is a short walk away, and everything you need is also within walking distance.

Name: Elizabeth Oleary
Text: Good location near the train station and metro. Lovely friendly staff. Warm room a good facilities

Name: Joana Mariano
Text: We have lived in this area before and it is where we come back everything we come to Paris. Away from the crowd, nice restaurants and shops and easy connection to the city center. Thus hotel is very cute and clean. People are very nice. We will be back.

Name: Bethania Edwards
Text:
Unfriendly front desk, asked about my nationality when I complained about AC not working   (summer). He advised me to go to another Hotel to stay cause they did not offered free breakfast and AC in ARB&B
. Crazy!

Name: oxpamexo :3
Text: Unfortunately, I did not look at the opinions before, just look at the way the administrator responds to the comments and you will realize that the place is 0 professional.

Name: John Berendzen
Text: Don't be fooled by the photos and good reviews.  This hotel is a dump!  Great location but terrible place.  No AC.  No elevator.  Broken fixtures and appliances.  Most rooms face an interior courtyard with small windows.  No privacy, no view.

Name: Dale
Text:
Had falsely advertised room as having washer/dryer
Had falsely advertised room as having a fan

Room was very hot at night without a fan or air conditioner. Can hear street traffic, sounds from neighbouring rooms and plumbing from other rooms.
Much smaller than it appears in the photos.

Would have paid more to stay somewhere else. I'm happy to stay in a "budget" hotel, however the description should accurately match what is provided.

Judging by other reviews here, the owner would rather chastise customers rather than attending to issues with the property, which is disappointing.

Was definitely one of the more uncomfortable stays I've had, but not the worst.

Most of the staff were surprisingly friendly, which was a relief.

Name: Dr. Carlos Olmo
Text:
When I went in, they adked me rudely what im doing there. They asked me  "where i was from" I answer them, " why you want to know?" When I started answering in French, they looked me bad, after that my friends meet us in the reception. He said hello "Doctor Olmo", they were so surprised, then,  they apologized saying, "I thought you were from a Spanish group". I felt their questionaire were RACISTS!
Personnel against foreigners. Non professional personnel!  I visited a guess on this hotel. I own 7 hotels in Spain, Belgium, Netherlands, Seoul, Portugal and 2 in the United States. Looking at their advertisement says Breakfast included, REALLY! NO is not included.

Name: joseph perezzi
Text: Extremely rude people at the front desk. They promise air conditioner and breakfast however this is a lie when you get there they tell you that the publication where you found it it's incorrect. Try to avoid this hotel by all means it's horrible horrible experience

Name: Abdullah Haider
Text:
After staying there for 2 days it was good
But then I asked the owner for a discount if i a booked more days as a usual costomer !
He was so rude to me and he said to me in an angry expression "if you dont like this price tomorrow you pack you bag and leave" waving his hand as a sign of kicking me out. It was really unprofessional way to speak to a customer i wasn't expecting this

Name: Alex Castaneda
Text: Worst service ever, they advertised breakfast and AC included in package, which once you arrived they are quick to tell you, it is not available. Their response after showing them their own add is that you can leave and go to another hotel. Save yourself some headache and donâ€™t booked here

Name: carlos
Text: Save you money one of the worst hotel ever Xenophobic, false advertisement. BREAKFAST AND A/C IS NOT INCLUDED clerks nasty management doesnâ€™t care unprofessional if you want to have a nice vacation and have a good impression of Paris people skip this unprofessional place thereâ€™s more hotels close by more professional and amigable

Name: twins78 fcuk
Text: Charming and beautiful hotel in amazing quiet location of montparnasse, cross the road to the high street with so many restaurants and shops, gaite mÃ©tro is 2 min walk, montparnasse mÃ©tro is 5 minute walk, eifl Tower is 20 minute by bus, the room is very clean with confortable bed, tv, hair dryer, safe, lovely shower, you get a good selection of breakfast in the morning, the staff are absolutely amazing!! they made feel very welcome, friendly very helpful, I can't thank them enough, I really enjoyed my stay, ihighly recommend this beautiful charming hotel in this amazing location with amazing staff, definitely the next time I go to Paris I will use again ğŸ˜Š

Name: Nicole Costa
Text: I asked to change the dates, because I had covid. They agreed to change the dates. But now that I'm traveling to Paris I called the hotel to make sure everything was ok and it was a headache. Terrible at English, they don't understand anything or make an effort. Super nasty and arrogant to talk to. They don't respond to emails. In the end, I paid for the entire stay, but as I didn't show up on the reservation date because I had covid (this reservation I tried to change and they accepted) I lost all the money. I didn't ask to cancel, I just asked to change dates (dates that were cheaper than when I booked, that is, they even gained from it). Unfortunate. It completely ruined my vacation. Very disappointed.

Name: Devon Vehlow
Text:
Good clean rooms.

I enjoyed my stay in 2017 and considered booking again. But the level of professionalism from the Hotel in responding to reviews is shocking. Because of this I have down graded my score. I haven't been back to the hotel and the response to other guests will prevent me from going.

But my stay was pleasant

Name: Alex Hateznino
Text: Rude staff, cheating with photos on the site, dirty room and around in a hotel.

Name: Camilo AristizÃ¡bal
Text: I lived a very uncomfortable xenophobic moment. Bad attention and very rude people.

Name: Red
Text: What a  disappointment we went to paris the city of love, and found the city of hate and xenophobia.  The hotel staff do not know how to treat tourists, it is unfortunate that the Paris authorities allow hotels of such poor quality to serve tourists and give them a bad impression of Paris and its people.  In my opinion they are racist, especially with (Latinos). How would Parisians feel if they were treated this badly in our countries?  What a shame for Paris that receives so much money from tourism.  They should apologize publicly.

Name: Kirsten Secher Villumsen
Text: Dirty room -  dust - marks on the curtins - not very nice! / bath room not clean! - Staff dit not listen and  trying to help us about an  extra quilt  ???

Name: Daniel Burgos
Text: Misleading advertisement and Racist attitude, a shame. I would never recommend this place if you want to feel welcome and have the services you actually paid for.

Name: Tajci 99
Text: Room was clean and cosy with cute garden, location of the hotel amazing, staff of the hotel were extremely nice and polite, there is option to leave baggage after check out.

Name: Gordon Ross
Text: No hot water for a shower in the morning, room safe did not work, no plates for breakfast only saucers, manager was very surley when approached about the problems. Otherwise the place was okay. Manager needs to go on a customer treatment course and accept responsibility. He said all properties had problems including my own home. Duh! My hot water works fine thank you. I was paying the hotel for the facilities to work. Best go somewhere else.

Name: Meziane Saidi
Text: I was alone in Paris. I got a room on the first floor, the overall experience was quite ok. I met a few issues though. The first of all is that my window was on the balcony, so I could hear and see everyone; that's even more annoying when some guys are having drinks in the balcony after 2 am. Also, the room could have been cleaner, especially the bathroom.

Name: Andreas NordansjÃ¶
Text:
There is a lot of things that is wrong with this hotel - and I am sure my experience was the worst, but in general: it is a bad hotel choice!

Maybe the worst part of this is that there were cockroaches all over the breakfast table the first morning. I complained and wanted to get my money back for the breakfast, but they did not let me. Horrible customer service.

Then, the walls are so thin you hear everything from everyone.

And there is no Air-condition. So the first night I spent being awake all night almost - I had about 28 degrees in my room. And when complaining saying I would like to check out early because I needed to be in good condition for work, they did not let me.

There was no ironing board or iron and even though I asked (honestly) 3 times per day, they did not manage to get me one. So I spent three days tired, hungry and with a wrinkly shirt.

Actually this was one of my worst hotel experiences ever. I would really advice against this hotel!

Name: John 117
Text: Horrible experience!! NO breakfasts, NO AC even though they posted in airbnb there was included. And a xenophobic receptionist keep asking me where am I from for complaining about the AC. NO RECOMMENDED

Name: Beatrice Tomasi
Text: The hotel has 3 people room and for us, a family of 3 it was fine. Well located, but maybe a bit overpriced for the quality of the product. We went during a high season period, so if you find a good deal it is a great place, close by rue Daguerre.

Name: J. Amezaga
Text: It's very centric, many different metro connections are nearby, a great nightlife street for dinner and drinks right around the corner, really great. It has had better days, but still in a comfortable condition. Staff is really nice and helpful. It's kid friendly too!

Name: jai hadgraft
Text: For me the location is the attraction for this hotel as rue daguerre is my favourite street in Paris.  Hotel is well placed for public transport with lots of interesting quirky sights and parks nearby.   Hotel itself is clean if a bit characterful, which I guess some people might not get.  For Brits visiting  - there is no kettle so pack a travel one for a brew.  Lots of food shopping and restaurants close by.  There were two minor bugs when we visited. The fridge/frigo didn't work because there was no power socket for it. However by day 2 of mentioning it someone gave us an extension lead we ran across the room and were able to keep  picnic things cool.  The other thing was the breakfast - seriously mediocre and at 10 euros a head you could get far better in one of the many cafes round the corner.   Overall though a good midrange place to stay if you are looking for a base to explore Paris from.

Name: Martin Svoboda
Text:
Comfortable smaller room. But if you don't need to practice marching dances in the morning, then the size is sufficient. The air conditioning was functional, only the smart TV did not have access to the network. Wi-fi worked, just a little slower on occasion. The hotel is cozy and clean. The breakfast was excellent.
The hotel is close to two major train stations and its accessibility is great. I can definitely recommend it.
As for the noise, we could hear the neighbors but nothing disturbed us and there was no noise in the street either.
We didn't notice a lift, so accessibility in case of limited mobility needs to be looked into.

Name: Catwoman
Text: I had already read some negative reviews about the rooms in this hotel, but not having booked in person I couldn't do much. The structure boasts a prestigious position, as it is easy to reach the various centers of interest with the nearby metro. We have always used the public transport services nearby. Breakfast was not included in the price, so we didn't get a chance to try it. The reception is small. At the entrance there is always someone who opens the door at any time you return to your room. As soon as we arrive we are immediately asked to pay the full amount of our stay. Not nice as it was 11pm and we had just landed after a long flight. Once we get to the room, the worst begins. Tiny room. Nightmare bathroom. It smells like sewage, a moldy ceiling, and unclean toilets. The most unpleasant thing was the non cleaning in the following days. They just made the bed and put the towels on. Never once was it swept to the ground. Day after day we find ourselves in 3 having to dodge our own hair that fell on the floor. A really disgusting feeling. Every time I had to go to the bathroom, I was holding my breath to avoid unpleasant smells. Inoperative ventilation system. Mini bar present but not working. As it was very cold we used the outside window sill to keep our drinks cool. Soundproofing of the rooms questionable. I could hear everything being said in the rooms next door. I would recommend a quick renovation of the rooms and focus on a more efficient cleaning service since the price paid for the stay is not low at all. I don't recommend this hotel.

Text:
Unfortunately the reviews we read before we went were largely confirmed.
The hotel struggles to actually reach the 3 stars for how it is designed, a real shame! Reception so-so, no receipt for payment was issued, the room lacked the mini-bar that should have been there; moreover, the triple room is rather small, perhaps too small, with a really poor bathroom.
The price is decent considering the area and the proximity to public transport as well as the nearby large Denfert Rochereau station. The latter is the most important point in favor. For the rest, little to report and nothing surprising.
The external part is nice, as well as the general layout of the rooms ... which, however, deserve more cleaning and care.

Name: Ricardo A. Soltero
Text:
I was not the one with the experience in this hotel, and I have to confess that I was a bit prejudiced towards this business, I explain:

Someone very close to me had to travel to a couple of cities in Europe for work a few days ago. Hours before leaving, he told me that he would be in Paris and mentioned this hotel.

It so happened that a couple of days before, I had seen the video of the youtuber Gabriel Herrera, and I remembered him at the moment, warning this person about that situation so that he would not get to that place.

She told me that she already had all the reservations made and she couldn't change them, but if something happened, she would ask the company she works for to relocate her to another hotel.

When she returned, she told me that nothing to do with it, they took very good care of her, there were those who spoke to her in Spanish, there was nothing to complain about, leaving aside that the AC was not working, but it was not necessary in those days either.

All of this led me to think about what I had believed, and why.

Reviewing the opinions that many people with Latin American names made, you realize that besides that they only have a few opinions, it is not something they do regularly, you can realize that they have hardly left their city, much less go to Paris.. . (neither do I). They only do it as support, if you can say so, to an influencer who uploaded that supposed experience in a business, in a place, etc.

Please, don't do that... You don't have to because, in addition to affecting a small company, its workers, the surrounding businesses that benefit from hotel guests, they affect those of us who trust the opinions we read in this service from Google to organize our trips, our outings for fun, work or living with the family, since when you see the rating like that of this business, you ignore it and look for another, perhaps having to pay more, or in a not so safe area , or you simply deprive yourself of what can be a beautiful experience. What they do is not correct, it is not ethical, and it gives a bad name to people who care about giving correct and informed information to all those who use this service, which can be put to excellent use.

By the way, if you search carefully, in the videos of this person on YT you can find some comments from people who dealt directly with him or with the couple, in which they say that he tried to use his "occupation" to avoid paying for services he contracted. .. It was a couple of comments, I don't really know if they are true, but we all know how the so-called "influencers" are handled...

Oh, and to the hotel staff, please avoid answering in such a rude and aggressive way to those people who obviously never went to your company, show more class than them, those answers make those who read them doubt the seriousness of who writes and who supports her

Name: Pao MoonDays
Text:
Excellent hotel with a perfect location, close to restaurants, bars, several metro and bus stations and a train station 15 minutes away on foot, which makes it easy to move around Paris without problems.

The hotel is small, there is a calm atmosphere, the rooms are modern and clean, the bathroom and shower area is spacious and it is also modern and 100% functional. The cleaning service every day is impeccable.

Absolutely all the staff were nice and friendly during the 7 days we stayed. They were always happy to answer our questions and even provided us with free bottles of water to keep us hydrated as it was 41Â°C in Paris.

The only thing I would recommend to the establishment is to invest in air conditioning, as summer in Paris can be very hot, and the rooms even with the fans do not feel cool, which some days makes it difficult to spend the night, especially if you do not want to leave the window open because you can see everything in the room opposite. If you suffer from heat, you must take this into account, if you book in summer. In winter the climate in the rooms must be perfect!

They also have a luggage storage service, before check-in and after check-out, which was perfect for us, because we could enjoy a few extra hours without carrying our bags everywhere.

They also have a common space on the ground floor and a breakfast room.

The Wi-Fi works well and throughout the property.

Name: Thom van den Bijgaart
Text:
Don't go here! Master class scam
After staying in a beautiful hotel for 2 nights, my girlfriend and I decided to book an extra night in Paris. Via booking.com we ended up at hotel Clairefontaine. At first glance a nice, well-maintained hotel with excellent rooms.

Arrival at the hotel was fine, the courtyard looked okay, but the staff was very unfriendly. Now we are used to something so this was not immediately a problem. Only when we entered our hotel room we were shocked. Mold at the bottom of the door that didn't close properly. A dirty bathroom (probably not cleaned) and there was a predominant sewer smell.

There was a chair with the chair leg broken off and we literally heard everything that happened above, below and outside. The filthiness of the room bothered us the most. We kindly asked if we could get another room. This was the owner's response: "If you don't like it, you're free to leave"

Do you treat paid guests like that who book a room of 150!!!! Euro which can be worth less than 50 euros. Unbelievable how you can be so unreasonable to a guest who pays so much money for a hotel room full of mold and smell.

He responds; you are after a commercial compensation or a breakfast. Well, we really don't care about the money.

Don't be fooled by the hotel's self-posted reviews and misleading photos

Read in one of the reviews below how the owner reacts to guests, what an unreasonable man.

IT'S HORRIBLE DO NOT GO HERE

I had a stay in week 29. I was very pleasantly surprised when I arrived. Had a nice room, which was perfect for 1 person. The room and bath were nice and clean. The hotel has a fantastic little courtyard which is quite cosy. Breakfast is served with fresh bread and side dishes (nothing is missing).
The hotel is perfectly located in relation to transport - approx. 5/10 min. to Metro and Montparnasse station.
There are many restaurants nearby for every taste.

The staff is very welcoming and friendly. You are seen and they are very helpful.

The only thing I missed was a fan for the hot nights.

If I were to come back to Paris, I would definitely return.

I can only warmly recommend the hotel.

Name: Zora Zouzouz7
Text:
Un Big Love pour cet hÃ´tel,
Mon premier passage est plus que satisfaisant.
J'Ã©tais agrÃ©ablement surprise par le charme de la chambre,trÃ¨s propre et ensoleillÃ©e.

TrÃ¨s facile a accÃ©der vu son emplacement ( pas loin de la station de mÃ©tro Denfert Rochereau,la GaietÃ© et Montparnasse + la gare Montparnasse).

Name: Frederik â€œHerr Fredulinâ€ Kleimann
Text:
We booked the hotel for 1 week through a provider. We had booked a comfort double room with breakfast.

When we arrived (Saturday evening) the receptionist said that our booking did not include breakfast and that it would only be possible with a surcharge (â‚¬10 per person per day). So off to a good start. After a short discussion we actually gave up breakfast and just wanted to go to the room. The room itself was modern, the bed was comfortable by my standards. The reception is staffed 24/7. The district is well frequented and has enough restaurants, excursion destinations and shops. Everything, including the two metro stations, can be easily reached on foot. That was actually all positive.

Arrived in the room, we were first hit by a heat wave, because someone had the idea of turning the heating to 6 in the bathroom and of course keeping the windows closed. The room itself is so small and musty that you basically had to sleep with the windows open the whole night. But the district is so busy that someone who doesn't sleep well can hardly sleep. In the room there is no closet for his things, but only 2 shelves. One of them was already full of pillows and a thicker blanket (for cold days). The second was half occupied by the safe, which didn't work due to empty batteries/accumulators.
In the bathroom, a small shower stall awaits you, where people over 1.80 actually have difficulties standing upright under the shower head. Quite apart from freedom of movement. There is no storage space for your shower utensils, so the only thing left to do is put them on the floor. Due to the small size of the cabin, bending down is hardly or not at all possible.
A toilet seat was attached to the toilet which didn't even begin to fit the toilet and was extremely loose. Speaking of loose, the door handle/locking plate was only hanging on a screw and could have simply been torn out of the door with a tug. The tiles were old and partly very broken, silicone seams and joints had a pleasant brown mold coating.

During a short absence, the cleaner charged her smartphone in our room using our cable while cleaning rooms on another floor.

Regarding the breakfast, we were finally able to contact the provider on Monday and address the problem with the booked breakfast, and then we received the booked breakfast from the next day at no extra charge. Well, what you could call breakfast. There was coffee, juice and tea. A small selection of muesli and cornflakes as well as small croissants and small pieces of baguette. In addition there was a choice of jam, Nutella or Kiri/cream cheese and a small selection of yoghurt or fruit must - there wasn't more and that for the price.

There is really no need to mention the loose railings in the inner courtyard and in the stairwell. This is simply a huge risk of accidents and an absolute no-go!

The fact that I was also internally upset about the crooked pictures in the stairwell does not matter in the assessment.

The fact is, however, that breakfast is not worth the extra charge and if the room booked was really a comfort room, then I don't want to know what a conventional double room looks like.

Therefore still dearly meant 2 out of 5 stars.

Name: ernesto zamacona
Text:
Hello! I am Mexican and looking for accommodation in Paris I found your hotel online, I have seen too many negative comments about the experience of a YT, so much so that I began to investigate, from videos on different channels and even experiences spoken by my father, my aunt and other relatives and acquaintances who have gone to France. They leave me thinking a lot, they have spoken to me and told me that in France there are so many xenophobic people that it is comparable to the United States and racism. The truth is that I really want to get to know Paris, so much so that I am learning the language. I have always been told that there are two sides of a coin, I would like to know which version of the story would be? Or what arguments do you have to defend yourself in this type of situation? Perhaps by making their version known they can change something with this rise in negative comments that arose. I hope you can answer me.
It's not a hate comment or something like that, I can't judge something if I don't know the place, but when looking for references on the Internet... well, it leaves a lot to say or think about. I really want to get to know the most famous city in France, maybe stay in one of its rooms with the idea that not everything is how they tell it. I will leave 3 stars until I have the experience and can change my opinion.

Name: Patrick StM
Text:
AUCUN SERIEUX AVEC DARTY
Nous avons commandÃ© une TV le 27/11/22 avec une livraison prÃ©vue le 08/12/22. Impeccable pour la coupe du monde de Foot ! Deux jours avant la livraison, Darty reporte celle-ci Ã  une date inconnue. Nous avons choisi cette TV car la marque TCL offre 150â‚¬ si l'achat est effectuÃ© avant le 28/11/22 avec envoi de dossier complet (facture, nÂ° de sÃ©rie Ã  l'arriÃ¨re de la TV, dÃ©coupage nÂ° de sÃ©rie sur le carton) Ã  retourner avant le 13/12/22 Ã  TCL. Nous contactons Ã  de multiples reprises le service client Darty, on nous reporte la livraison de semaines en semaines. Finalement, la livraison a lieu le 20/01/23 avec un geste commercial de 25â‚¬ pour le retard subit, que nous n'avons toujours pas reÃ§u ! Normalement, la facture est disponible 48h aprÃ¨s la livraison sur notre espace client. Nous contactons TCL pour l'offre de 150â‚¬ qui nous demande d'envoyer le dossier complet pour recevoir les 150â‚¬. Text: Leroy Merlin partners with an awful delivery company. This is a big reputation risk for them and they do not seem to be aware of that. First, the delivery man did not want to deliver the parcel to my apartment and wanted to leave it on the street. This is not stated in the webpage when ordering. After some convincing he accepted to deliver the parcel to my home. However, to my surprise, I have discovered that instead of properly disposing of the trash, he has abandoned it in front of my property. Really?? Is this how the trash is supposed to be managed? Name: Neeraj Chiktey
Text:
Avoid this hotel. They are crooks and unprofessional.
I will tell you my experience with this hotel.
I had made a booking for this hotel through booking.com from 15th July to 18th July.
When I reached the hotel, the hotel receptionist said that I need to pay 289 Euros but the original bill from booking.com mentioned that I need to pay 250 Euros.
I asked him to re-check. The hotel receptionist struggled for more than 1 hour with no results.
Looking receptionist struggling to get information, I agreed to pay more with the condition to re-check the bill amount a day after.
To pay the amount, I gave him my credit card. He told me that your payment is declined.
I presented him with another card, even for this card he told me that even for this card the payment is declined.
In this chaos, I booked another hotel.
A day after when I checked my credit card statements, I saw this hotel had charged me twice on the same card which was not working as per the receptionist. They had charged me on my credit card without my consent.
When I asked them to give my money back, they denied saying it is a cancellation charge.
I will suggest staying away from this hotel. Even if you are staying out of necessity, don't share a credit card. They are not someone who can be trusted.

Text:
The food was good but the service was terrible. We had to wait a long time for everything, from having to flag down waiters to order through to 20 minutes for an ice cream. They weren't even busy.

This we added to by the waiter asking repeatedly when we finally caught his attention... "Have you not had your drinks/starter/dessert yet". Given that he hadn't served them, the answer was obvious, NO!!!

Name: Beba 2
Text: Fast service, nice place, dÃ©tails only prevent 5 star rating. Eggs on my steak was overdone, same as chips.. While steak by my surprise was Minced meat.. Maybe translation differences here but under "steak" I expect to get - steak. One piece please. And don't use false taste smoke sauces on anything. That's bad.. Guinness beer was - too cold. In winter even.. Unbelievable. That's only beer you must serve room temp or its tasteless.. Place has enough room on ground floor and nice like balcony on top. Clean. Good dessert choices.. I'll try it one more time, this time ordering more specific, not trough menu. Let's see them improve. Location is great, altho your very lucky to find parking spot near..

Name: rohit hajare
Text: Nice place to hang out with friends or even with family. Some dishes from the menu are not available and this is disappointing. The service time is also not the quickest.

Name: Allan Mortimer
Text:
Today there was a large crowd as it is one of few restaurants open on Sundays. But service, although a bit slow was excellent - esp. for non French speakers. Cyrille, our waiter was happy, efficient, friendly even though he spoke very little English.

The burger was exellent, suculent and tasty, the veggie Flamm. is recommended - different from ALL other veggie dishes on other menus.

Well done!!!

Name: Freek!
Text:
Good food, friendly service, great athmosphere.
Kitchen is open up to 22:00 on weekdays, also on monday. Several tv screens show sports, but it is not disturbingly loud if you are there for a meal only. The food is great, the menu has typical french classics as well as burgers and finger-food.
The bar serves cocktails and some 6 beers from the tab (drafted).
The toilet is suitable for wheelchairs, but the cleaner probably was sick that day.
Worth a visit: yes!
Worth a detour: in fact: yes.
Worth a trip: up to 30-45 minutes.

Name: Stephen Fraser
Text: Had dinner here before a Sunday evening flight from Beauvais airport as it was the only place open in Beauvais on a Sunday evening. We arrived at 17:00, but had to wait until 18:00 to order food. Food was typical pub grub/bistro food but was well cooked and reasonable. I would recommend Au Bureau Beauvais

Text:
You know the famous office restaurant in Tampere, so you shouldn't confuse it with this restaurant of the same name. This is in a completely different city and in a different country. But you can also get beer here. Several different species too. After all, the menu here is quite diverse, maybe too diverse, and it raises the doubt that every portion is good? Well, the ones we tasted with the group were quite ok.

Let me tell you again that this is a French take on a British pub? And the food is like pub food. We also offer nice snack portions to share with friends when you're enjoying a bottle of wine after work. Then you can sleep poorly and go after nine to build or design tractors. However, it is probably the city's main industry.

Now let's give a plus for the service, especially because the waiter didn't set us up outside and the nail trays weren't bitumen black, as some reviews said. In addition, the customer service staff mainly understood English well enough. The names of the beers might be a bit difficult for some.

Anyway if you are in Beauvais I recommend this place, especially for Football fans
